description.narrative: According to Sida’s Rule for managing contributions, a risk analysis shall be carried out annually in line with Article 14 – Procurement, in the Agreement on Core Support (2018 -2021) with Musika. The risk analysis consists of assessing the procurement procedures of the agreement partner. Given that, no procurement Audit has been conducted under the current support, a decision has been taken to contract a consultant to perform an assessment/audit.The purpose of the procurement audit is to perform an assessment of the procurement procedures within Musika. The assessment will provide input to the Embassy regarding the compliance of procurement regulations and eventual other documentation guiding the procurement processes. The focus shall be on organizational arrangements as well as resources, competence and capacity at all levels relating to procurement; contracting, contract management, administration processes, etc. The consultant is expected to identify strengths and weaknesses, and present recommendations on how to act on identified weaknesses. Based on the findings, the Embassy will decide on how to follow-up, to ensure Musika addresses the eventual weaknesses during the remaining agreement period.
